item.title: Setting up a Raspberry Pi Media Server
item.description: It has been a little over three years since I have setup a Raspberry Pi based wireless media server. This little media server has done a great job and it continues to function flawlessly serving many DLNA clients in the home network including one 3D projector, several mobile phones, tablets, PCs and Macs. I needed an always on light weight media server that can serve all of my DLNA compliant devices.

item.title: My First Glide App
item.description: Over the years, I have acquired a fair number of electronic devices. Many of these carry built in batteries and require frequent charging. Only a few of these devices are in regular use. Many sit in shelves, sometimes even months without any use. To much of my dismay, a few of these silently died in shelves due to completely drained batteries. After loosing a fair amount of beloved gadgets, I finally decided to have some control over the charging business.

item.title: Getting Rid of ._ and .DS_Store Files
item.description: You may be a Windows user who received a bunch of folders from a work colleague who is using a Mac. Or you may be frequently sharing files between a Mac and a Windows computer. Or you may be copying files from your Mac to USB sticks. Whatever the use case, you must have encountered the mystical and annoying ._ files. What exactly are these files? How do you get rid of them?

item.title: Metabolomics: A Potential Path for Early Detection of Terminal Diseases
item.description: Early detection is a misnomer. At the time of diagnosis, a solid tumor developing in the breast, colon, lung, or prostate has grown to 1 cm in size and contains 1 billion cells. The average time for this growth to reach a detectable size is 10 years. Cancer destined to spread to other vital organs has already done so.

item.title: About
item.description: Dr. Lochana C. Menikarachchi obtained his Ph.D. in Computational Biochemistry from the University of Connecticut, USA. He has more than 10 years of experience in interdisciplinary research, designing and developing software tools for life/chemical sciences industry.
